comPort_h.helpdecTxt: The serial connector allows you to connect legacy and auxiliary equipment to the Axis product. Once connected, a device can be configured to receive data such as alarms and messages. After consulting the auxiliary device's user documentation, select the appropriate settings for connecting to the product.
comPort_h.helpPortSettingsTxt: Check the Enable port to enable the serial port and reveal more options.
comPort_h.helpSerialSettingsTxt: Generic HTTP - Check this box to enable the serial port to be controlled by HTTP applications.
comPort_h.helpPTZSettingsTxt: Pan Tilt Zoom - Check this box to enable the port to be used for controlling a connected PTZ device. Click Upload and select driver to upload a compatible driver. Click Specify advanced device settings to set, for example, mechanical limits for the driver.
comPort_h.helpPTZSettingsTxt-1: Pan Tilt Zoom - The port can be used for controlling a connected PTZ device. Click Upload and select driver to upload a compatible driver.
comPort_h.helpPTZSettingsTxt1: Note that if the port type is Daisy Chain Client, a Daisy chain server must be running on another CPU for the driver to work.
comPort_h.helpTCPSettingsTxt1: Generic TCP/IP - Check this box to enable the port to be controlled by TCP applications.
comPort_h.helpTCPSettingsTxt2: Allowed IP addresses - Enter IP addresses allowed to communicate with the product. Each of the four parts of an IP address can be represented as
comPort_h.helpTCPSettingsTxt2-1: Allowed IP addresses - Enter IP addresses allowed to communicate with the product. Each of the parts of an IP address can be represented as
comPort_h.helpTCPSettingsTxt6: Use a comma as a separator for multiple patterns, for example 12.123.12-17.123-127,12.123.*.*
comPort_h.helpTCPSettingsTxt7: Timeout - If there is no activity on the connection for this amount of time, it will close. The value '0' means no timeout or wait.
comPort_h.helpTCPSettingsTxt8: Connect to - Check this box if the product should act as a client and connect to another host when data is received on the serial port.
comPort_h.helpTCPSettingsTxt9: Host and Port - Enter the IP address and port number of the host.
comPort_h.helpTCPSettingsTxt10: Listener - The TCP server port to listen on.
comPort_h.helpTCPSettingsTxt16: Use a comma as a separator for multiple patterns, for example 12.123.12-17.123-127,12.123.*.*,1:0:0:0:*:0:0:34ff-35ff
comPort_h.helpRemoteServerTxt1: Daisy chain server - Check this box to enable the Daisy chain server and to reveal more options.
comPort_h.helpRemoteServerTxt2: Allowed IP addresses - Enter IP addresses allowed to communicate with the product. See Generic TCP/IP for information about entering IP address combinations.
comPort_h.helpRemoteServerTxt3: Timeout - If there is no activity on the connection for this amount of time, it will close. The value '0' means no timeout or wait.
comPort_h.helpRemoteServerTxt4: Port - The server port to listen on.
comPort_h.helpRemoteServerTxt5: Authentication key - Enter the remote server's authentication key. Use exactly 10 characters.
comPort_h.helpRemoteServerTxt6: Note that a Daisy chain client must not be used on the same CPU as the Daisy chain server is running on.
comPort_h.helpRemoteServerTxt7: Note: The Axis product automatically generates the server authentication key when reset to factory default settings and will authenticate remote PTZ by default. To increase security, replace the default key with your own.
comPort_h.helpPortTypeTxt: Port type - Select the desired port type from the drop-down list.
comPort_h.helpSerialPortSettingsTxt: Port mode - Select the desired port mode from the drop-down list.
comPort_h.help13Txt: None, Even, Odd, Mark or Space
comPort_h.helptBTxt: Termination/Bias -Check these boxes to use termination and/or bias functions.
comPort_h.helpDaisySettings2Txt: Authentication key - Enter the authentication key of the daisy chain client.
comPort_h.helpDaisySettingsNoteTxt: Note: The Axis product automatically generates the client authentication key when reset to factory default settings and will authenticate a client by default. To increase security, replace the default key with your own.

ioports_h.intro_Txt: This page allows configuration of the input and output ports supported by this device. Ports can be given descriptive names, and their Normal state can be configured.
ioports_h.inactive_Txt: An input will be inactive as long as its Normal state equals its Current state.
ioports_h.options_Txt: The two options for Normal state are
ioports_h.in_states_Txt1: The input is activated when the state changes from the Normal state.
ioports_h.in_states_Txt2: As an example, if the Normal state for a pushbutton connected to an input is Open circuit, this means that as long as the button is not pushed, the Current Status will be Inactive.
ioports_h.in_states_Txt3: When the button is pushed, the circuit is grounded, the input's state changes to Grounded Circuit. and the input will no longer be in its normal state the Current Status will be Active
ioports_h.in_states_Txt4: An input on the Axis product has an Open Circuit when disconnected or when there is a voltage above 1V DC.
ioports_h.in_states_Txt5: The input is activated when the Current state changes so that it no longer equals the Normal state.
ioports_h.in_states_Txt6: As an example, if the Normal state for a pushbutton connected to an input is Open circuit, this means that as long as the button is not pushed (and the Current state remains as Open Circuit), the state will be inactive.
ioports_h.in_states_Txt7: When the button is pushed, the circuit
ioports_h.in_example_opto_Txt: closes, the input's state changes to Closed Circuit
ioports_h.in_example_trans_Txt: is grounded, the input's state changes to Grounded Circuit
ioports_h.in_example_end_Txt: and the input will no longer be in its normal state - it will have become active.
ioports_h.in_voltage_Txt: An input on the product has an Open Circuit when disconnected or when there is a voltage above 1V DC.
ioports_h.outputs_default_Txt1: In the product, as long as the Current state is Open circuit, the output is disconnected (floating). When the circuit closes, the current state will change to Closed circuit.
ioports_h.outputs_default_Txt2: The default hardware setting for outputs on the product is Open circuit. This will also be the case every time the unit is restarted.
ioports_h.outputs_default_Txt3: Note that while the unit is restarting, the output will be in the default hardware state (i.e. Open circuit) for at least as long as it takes for the unit to fully initialize. Consider this carefully when connecting equipment to the output. After a completed restart, the unit will then switch to Open circuit (but only if configured to do so.)
ioports_h.outputs_trans_Txt1: In the product, as long as the current state is Open circuit, the output is disconnected (floating). When the circuit is grounded, the current state changes to Grounded circuit.
ioports_h.outputs_trans_Txt2: The default hardware setting for outputs on the product is Open circuit. This will also be the case every time the unit is restarted.
ioports_h.outputs_trans_Txt3: While the unit is restarting, the output will be in the default hardware state (i.e. Open circuit) for at least as long as it takes for the unit to fully initialize. Consider this carefully when connecting equipment to the output. After a completed restart, the unit will then switch to Grounded circuit (but only if configured to do so).
ioports_h.outputs_note_Txt: Note: Changing and saving settings on this page will also reset outputs to their default states. The state will be correct the next time the triggering event activates the output.
ioports_h.conn_nodiagram_Txt: For details of the connections available on the
ioports_h.conn_seeUM_Txt: product, please see the User's Manual.
ioports_h.single_help_diagram_Txt: For detailed information on how to connect the input and output on this device, please see the User's Manual.

pirport_h.intro_Txt: Passive InfraRed sensor (PIR Sensor) is an electronic device that measures infrared (IR) light radiating from objects in its field of view. It is generally used to detect movement, even in the dark and it can be used as an intruder alarm when, for example, a thief tries to break into a building at night.
pirport_h.testLightHintTxt1: Motion is detected when an infrared object such as a person that has one temperature passes in front of another object that has a different temperature such as a wall. An Action Rule can be configured to use PIR sensor to trigger an event which can automatically result in a camera doing an action such as activating the light, record video or send notification such as an email etc.
pirport_h.testLightHintTxt2: PIR Sensor State - This setting shows the current state of the PIR Sensor, such as being active or inactive.
pirport_h.testLightHintTxt3: Sensitivity Settings - This setting is used to adjust the sensitivity of the PIR Sensor from 0 - 100%. The default sensitivity is 75%.
pirport_h.testLightHintTxt4: To set up a suitable sensitivity for when the PIR sensor triggers, first go to Events and set up an Action Rule using PIR as a Trigger. Then set sensitivity by moving the sensitivity slider to adjust the PIR Sensor's sensitivity and range until the light is triggered. By increasing the sensitivity, the range of the PIR Sensor is also increased
pirport_h.introsimple_Txt: This page shows the status of the PIR Sensor.

rsPort_h.introTxt: The COM port on the Axis product supports several operational modes. Choose the desired Port mode and Usage from the drop-down lists. The following operational modes are available:
rsPort_h.tcpTxt: Generic TCP/IP - allows the port to be controlled by TCP/IP applications.
rsPort_h.hTTPTxt: Generic HTTP - allows access to the port via HTTP.
rsPort_h.pTZTxt: Pan Tilt Zoom - uses the port to control a Pan Tilt Zoom device. A PTZ device requires a driver for its function. Drivers may be obtained from www.axis.com

rsPort_http_h.daisyTxt: This mode should be selected if the HTTP applications are connected in a daisy chain.
rsPort_http_h.keyTxt1: Authentication Key - The Axis product provides a single RS-485 port, which is available on video input 1. This port can be used to control PTZ devices, and it can also be accessed by HTTP applications.
rsPort_http_h.keyTxt2: Although the single RS-485 port is provided on video input 1, it is still possible for the other video inputs to access it, by making use of internal connections between the inputs in the product.
rsPort_http_h.keyTxt3: Each connection can optionally be protected by the use of an authentication key, which must consist of 10 alphanumeric characters. The same key should be used by all other video inputs that wish to use the port.
rsPort_http_h.keyTxt4: Note: If video input 1 is restarted independently of the other inputs, this will terminate any active PTZ or HTTP connections to inputs 2-4. To fix this, either restart the whole product, or de-select and re-select PTZ or HTTP as the usage on the RS-485 port.
rsPort_http_h.help1Txt: Generic HTTP allows the port to be controlled by HTTP applications. The available parameters are listed below.

rsPort_ptz_h.daisyTxt: PTZ devices can be connected in a daisy chain allowing the devices to share a single serial port. See User's Manual for instructions.
rsPort_ptz_h.help1Txt: Selecting Pan Tilt Zoom enables the port to be used for controlling a connected PTZ device. Basic serial port settings can be adjusted by clicking the Port Options button.
rsPort_ptz_h.keyTxt1: Authentication Key - The Axis product provides a single RS-485 port, which is available on video input 1. This port can be used to control PTZ devices, and it can also be accessed by HTTP applications.
rsPort_ptz_h.keyTxt2: Although the single RS-485 port is provided on video input 1, it is still possible for the other video inputs to access it, by making use of internal connections between the inputs in the product.
rsPort_ptz_h.keyTxt3: Each connection can optionally be protected by the use of an authentication key, which must consist of 10 alphanumeric characters. The same key should be used by all other video inputs that wish to use the port.
rsPort_ptz_h.keyTxt4: Note: If video input 1 is restarted independently of the other inputs, this will terminate any active PTZ or HTTP connections to inputs 2-4. To fix this, either restart the whole product, or de-select and re-select PTZ or HTTP as the usage on the RS-485 port.
rsPort_ptz_h.help2Txt1: This section shows the name and version of the PTZ driver currently in use. To install a new driver, click the Upload button.
rsPort_ptz_h.help2Txt2: PTZ drivers can be obtained from www.axis.com.
rsPort_ptz_h.help2Txt3: Please note that using the wrong PTZ driver for a PTZ device may cause unwanted effects.
rsPort_ptz_h.help3Txt1: After uploading a PTZ driver, select the video source it will be used on. Depending on the PTZ driver being used, it may be possible to control several PTZ units (for several video sources), by connecting these in a 'daisy chain'
rsPort_ptz_h.help3Txt2: In this case, each unit is automatically given a unique Device ID, so that the driver can differentiate between the various units. These ID values may be changed as desired. Please see the documentation for your PTZ unit for information on how to set device ID values.
rsPort_ptz_h.help3Txt3: It may also be possible to select the (PTZ) Device Type for the video source.

rsPort_tcpip_h.helpPortsTxt1: Choose the port mode. The available options are:
rsPort_tcpip_h.help1Txt: Generic TCP/IP allows the port to be controlled by TCP/IP applications. The available parameters are listed below.
rsPort_tcpip_h.help19Txt: The IP address and port number to use if the Axis product should act as a client and connect to another host when data is received on the serial port.
rsPort_tcpip_h.help21Txt2: If no port number is specified, the Listener Port (see below) is used.
rsPort_tcpip_h.help23Txt: The TCP Server port to listen on. Default is 4001. If 0 or empty, server functionality is disabled for the port.
rsPort_tcpip_h.help26Txt: If there is no activity on the connection for this time, it will be closed. 0 means no timeout/wait forever.
rsPort_tcpip_h.help29Txt: Set to YES to use Telnet options for controlling settings and pin status.
rsPort_tcpip_h.help32Txt: Use comma or space as separator. For this option to work Support Telnet Option must be set to YES.
rsPort_tcpip_h.help35Txt: Use comma or space as separator.

driverMan_settings_h.help1Txt: A PTZ driver is required for the correct function of a connected Pan Tilt Zoom device.
driverMan_settings_h.help2Txt1: To upload a PTZ driver, enter the name of the file in the text field, or use the Browse button to locate it. Then click the Upload button. The driver will be uploaded and automatically installed.
driverMan_settings_h.help2Txt2: By checking the box provided, it is also possible to Force the driver installation, that is, to install the driver even if there might be a conflict with the installed firmware. This function can be useful in certain circumstances, e.g. for test purposes, or when installing new driver versions on older firmware versions. Note that the Force option will have no effect on serious conflicts.
driverMan_settings_h.help3Txt2: Note that replacing or re-installing a PTZ driver will set all of the PTZ unit's parameters to the default settings for the new driver.
driverMan_settings_h.help3Txt3: Using the correct driver for the PTZ unit is important, but it is equally important to use a driver that supports the serial port protocol (RS485, RS232, etc.)
driverMan_settings_h.help3Txt4: To completely uninstall a PTZ driver, simply perform the driver upload again, but do not specify a file name.

portMan_settings_h.help1Txt: After selecting Pan Tilt Zoom for the port, there are several serial port settings that can be configured. The default values correspond to the values specified by the PTZ driver.
portMan_settings_h.help13Txt: To restore the default settings for the selected driver, click the Default button.

portStatus_h.help1Txt: This list shows the status for the
portStatus_h.help1Txt-1: This list shows the status of the input and output ports supported by the Axis product.
portStatus_h.help8bTxt: The ports shown in the list cannot be configured here - this must be done from Ports & Devices in the System options, which requires administrator access.

accelerometer_h.intro_Txt: The leveling assistant produces audio beeps and changes the color of the status LED to ensure that the Axis product is mounted horizontally during installation.
accelerometer_h.Leveling1_Txt: The leveling assistant is enabled by default. To disable it, uncheck the Enable leveling assistant box and click Save. To restore the leveling assistant to previous settings, click Reset.
accelerometer_h.Leveling2_Txt: To activate the leveling assistant, press and hold the assistant button (hardware button 1) for two seconds.
accelerometer_h.Leveling2_Txt-1: To activate the leveling assistant, press and hold the Function button (button 2) for two seconds.
accelerometer_h.Leveling2buttons_Txt: To activate the leveling assistant, press and hold the Function button for two seconds.
accelerometer_h.Leveling3_Txt: The internal speaker produces short beeps when the leveling assistant is active. The delay between the beeps decreases gradually as the camera approaches a 0, 90, 180 or 270 degree angle. When the angle is 0, 90, 180 or 270 degrees the tone is continuous.
accelerometer_h.Leveling4_Txt: Similarly, the status LED changes from flashing red to flashing yellow to flashing green as the camera approaches a 0, 90, 180 or 270 degree angle. When the angle is 0, 90, 180 or 270 degrees the LED will turn green.
accelerometer_h.Leveling5_Txt: To deactivate the leveling assistant, press and hold the assistant button for more than 2 seconds.
accelerometer_h.Leveling5_Txt-1: To deactivate the leveling assistant, press and hold the Function button for more than 2 seconds.
accelerometer_h.Leveling5buttons_Txt: To deactivate the leveling assistant, press and hold the Function button (button 2) for more than 2 seconds.
accelerometer_h.LevelingNote_Txt: Note: The leveling assistant will automatically deactivate itself when it has been active for more than 15 minutes.
